document_data.name: Hannaah Befling
document_data.mainbody:
'''Hannaah Befling''' was an inhabitant of the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{Quote|''This Figaro fellow must be good if his appointments take this long.''|Hannaah Befling}}
document_data.Description: Hannaah was an aged [[human]] woman with a light skin tone, and hair silvered with age cut in an elegant bob. She wore a simple blouse and a [[corset]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Hannaah Befling was a customer of the [[Facemaker Fashion]] boutique. On the day the shop's proprietor was attacked by the [[Bhaalist]] assassins, Hannaah impatiently waited for her appointment in a queue outside of the shop.
